title: SIGBUS and EGL_BAD_CONFIG errors
text: Hello,In working through the sample application documentation in the SAP_3D_Visual_Enterprise_Developer_SDK_for_Apps_Version_1_2, I encounter the following errors:1) On a AT&T Samsung Galaxy II Skyrocket with ICS 4.0.4, once the model is loaded, I get a SIGBUS error when the renderer attempts to render:09-30 20:38:41.498: A/libc(4879): Fatal signal 7 (SIGBUS) at 0x00000000 (code=128)Has anyone encountered this before that you are aware?2) When I try to run it on my Sambsung Galaxy Tab 7" or on Google Glass, I get a different error:09-30 20:42:57.396: E/AndroidRuntime(23427): FATAL EXCEPTION: GLThread 4862409-30 20:42:57.396: E/AndroidRuntime(23427): java.lang.RuntimeException: createContext failed: EGL_BAD_CONFIG09-30 20:42:57.396: E/AndroidRuntime(23427): at android.opengl.GLSurfaceView$EglHelper.throwEglException(GLSurfaceView.java:1193)09-30 20:42:57.396: E/AndroidRuntime(23427): at android.opengl.GLSurfaceView$EglHelper.throwEglException(GLSurfaceView.java:1184)09-30 20:42:57.396: E/AndroidRuntime(23427): at android.opengl.GLSurfaceView$EglHelper.start(GLSurfaceView.java:1034)09-30 20:42:57.396: E/AndroidRuntime(23427): at android.opengl.GLSurfaceView$GLThread.guardedRun(GLSurfaceView.java:1401)09-30 20:42:57.396: E/AndroidRuntime(23427): at android.opengl.GLSurfaceView$GLThread.run(GLSurfaceView.java:1240)Any help you could provide would be very useful.Thanks,Patrick
author: Patrick O'Shaughnessey

title: How to use Visual Enterprise for custom apps?
text: Hello All,I am a Portal consultant. I have predominantly worked in the areas of SAP Portal, UIs like WD Java, ABAP and UI5. Recently in the blog by Mr. The specified item was not found., there was mention of SAP Visual Enterprise. On further investigation, its clear that its 3D tool to represent graphic content. My question as a consultant/developer is how would we be able to work on this tool. Is it a tool bought and used by customer with minimal software code? Is it similar to SAP Visual Compoer tool?Request the forum members who are into this space to share some details.Thank you.Regards,Sharath
author: Sharath M G
shiny .
text: Hi,I also need help for the above question.Regards,shiny
title: Re:How to use Visual Enterprise for custom apps?

author: Sharath M G
text: Hello Shiny,Visual Enterprise seems to be a 3D visualization tool in line with existing 3d tools. What I am interested in the process of integrating this tool in the Portal or the existing UI technologies like WDJ/WDA/UI5.Regards,Sharath
title: Re:How to use Visual Enterprise for custom apps?

author: shiny .
text: Hi Sharath,Can you please share any document which will be helpful for a SAP Visual enterprise beginners.Thanks,shiny
title: Re:How to use Visual Enterprise for custom apps?

author: Vladimir Noskov
text: Hi Sharath,There is an overview:SAP 3D Visual Enterprise Viewer SDK. Allows integration of SAP 3D Visual Enterprise Viewer into 3rd party Windows applications- embedded as an ActiveX control- Provides documentation for embedding into Windows, SAPGUI, Web dynpro and HTML- Provides documentation to control Viewer functionality. SAP 3D Visual Enterprise applications SDK. Allows integration of SAP 3D Visual Enterprise Viewer for mobile applications, iOS and Android.- Provides documentation to control Viewer functionality.  SAP 3D Visual Enterprise core SDK. Allows building plug-ins to extend functionality of SAP 3D Visual Enterprise Author, SAP 3D Visual Enterprise Generator, and SAP 3D Visual Enterprise Viewer. - 2D and 3D data import. An import plug-in allows files of a particular format to be imported for further authoring or publishing.- 2D and 3D data export. An export plug-in allows saving files in a particular format.- Extending SAP 3D Visual Enterprise Author or SAP 3D Visual Enterprise Viewer UI to add custom functionality. Plug-ins can perform various operations on the internal representation of 2D or 3D content. SAP 3D Visual Enterprise Generator SDK. Allows integration of SAP 3D Visual Enterprise Generator into 3rd party applications- The API consists of a set of web services (SOAP)- Allows applications to start and monitor the progress of processing workflows.- Allows for transfer of files to/from the server.- In standalone mode allows for storage search and retrieval of stored viewable files SDK's could be downloaded from http://scn.sap.com/community/developer-center/3d-visual-enterprisePlease let me know if you need more information.thank you,Vladimir
title: Re:How to use Visual Enterprise for custom apps?

author: shiny .
text: Hi Vladimir,So as per your explaination, we are having1)SAP 3D Visual Enterprise Viewer SDK2)SAP 3D Visual Enterprise applications SDK3)SAP 3D Visual Enterprise core SDK4)SAP 3D Visual Enterprise Generator SDKSo, normally which one will be used for developing solution using SAP Visual enterprise for certain business process.For example for validations.Regards,shiny
title: Re:How to use Visual Enterprise for custom apps?

author: Robert Abarbanel
text: Shiny - not sure what you mean by validations.Most commonly, the Viewer SDK (on PCs) is used to develop applications. If on iOS or Android, you would need the applications SDK.You may also be interested in ABAP applications. Seehttp://scn.sap.com/community/developer-center/3d-visual-enterprise/blog/2013/11/22/embed-ve-viewer-inside-sap-gui
title: Re:How to use Visual Enterprise for custom apps?

author: shiny .
text: Hi Robert,can you please share any link for webdynpro jva applications?Thanks,shiny
title: Re:How to use Visual Enterprise for custom apps?

text: Hello Friends,Using SAP VE SDK,how can i programmaticly highlight a particular node.regardskaushik
author: kaushik hegde

title: Visual Enterprise element in chrome
text: Hi all,I am working on a website and I am trying to display a visual element object.This is the code that I wrote:<object id="ev3de" type="application/rh" border="0" width="100%" height="100%"> <param name="BackStyle" value="0" /> <param name="FillColor" value="16777215" /></object>When the page is loaded I am running the following code: LocalEv3de = document.getElementById("ev3de"); Scene = LocalEv3de.Scene; if (Scene == null) { alert("Scene is null"); } } ...This code has different behaviours on explorer and chrome.The first time I run it in chrome I get the message "Scene is null" and refreshing the page keeps displaying the same alert.When I run it in Explorer the scene is not null and the element is displayed as expected.After displaying the message in the Explorer browser chrome does not give any alert and displays the message as well.My target is to develop a website that is not dependent in the browser the user has.Does anybody know what causes the differences in the visual element behaviour?Thank you.
author: Ohad Duering
Ohad Duering
text: By the way I installed tomcat server on my machine and didn't have any problems to load the virtual element from the chrome browser. It seems the problem appears only when I use chrome with Hana Database.
title: Re:Visual Enterprise element in chrome
How to run a query in VEV HTML application?
text: Hello,We are developing an HTML application using VEV sdks. Anybody knows how we can run a query saved in a .rhq file using on-click event in HTML?
author: Rupesh Khopade
Robert Abarbanel
text: You call the executequery(string) JavaScript function. That means you need to have the text from the rhq file. You can ignore the comments there (// lines and text following // on any line). If you you want to read the text literally from the file, you can do that in HTML5 with a method like thisHow to open a local disk file with Javascript? - Stack OverflowMost likely you will use fixed strings or compose them in JavaScript and then run them via the function call.
title: Re:How to run a query in VEV HTML application?

author: Rupesh Khopade
text: Thanks Robert,It worked! As you guessed it right we composed the querry in Javascript and run the function call.Thanks once again for your help!Regards,Rupesh
title: Re:How to run a query in VEV HTML application?
Preset VE Viewer preferences in API via current VE Viewer SDk
text: In the current VE Viewer SDK, we need a method to set viewer preferences.... uncheck rollover labels, uncheck backfacing geometry, set top and bottom background colors, etc. In our current productions, VE Viewer 7.0xx is embedded in an API that we have developed using the provided VE Viewer SDK 7.0 as the base viewer. This has been a known bug, but we do not currently have a resolution.We need viewer preferences pre-set prior to .rh content load. Currently, we have to rely on the end-user (customer) to set specific preferences in VE Viewer 7.0.. outside of our API. As you may have experienced, even with specific directions, the end-user is not always the best choice for setting any preferences in VE Viewer or any other program.to Vlad Noskov;Hi Vlad,I do not know if this bug has been fixed in the current VE Viewer SDK, but if it has not, we really need this.Regards,Bill
author: William Tucker
Robert Abarbanel
text: William -Are you aware of the IDeepView.ExecuteCommand Method that is documented in the API chm document? It provides command codes like Rollover LabelsM1275which can set that feature ON or OFF. I beleieve you can issue these commands before, or after, a model is loaded.Bob
title: Re:Preset VE Viewer preferences in API via current VE Viewer SDk

author: William Tucker
text: I will pass this along to our developer.Regards,Bill
title: Re:Preset VE Viewer preferences in API via current VE Viewer SDk
Where are the VE Author logs for plug-in loading?
text: I am writing an import/export plug-in which I can compile successfully but gives an error when loading in VE Author 7.1. The only clues that I can see is a message from the bottom-right warning icon that says 'error loading myPlugin.x3d' and a similar error in the appropriate row of the plug-in manager. How do I get debugging information or access logs?
author: Russell Harris
Vladimir Noskov
text: Hi Russel,The location for log and trace files of VE Author 7.1:%USERPROFILE%\AppData\Local\Temp\Low\SAP\SAP Visual Enterprise Author 7.1\However it looks like you haven't defined entry point correctly. Please make sure you plugin is matching ones from SDK samples.thank you,Vladimir Noskov
title: Re:Where are the VE Author logs for plug-in loading?

author: Russell Harris
text: Thanks Vladimir for your answer. I found the logs but they were not very helpful at all, they simply repeated the 'error loading myPlugin.x3d' message and gave no other information. Is there any way that the debug level can be increased?Also, I compiled an example from the SDK for the vrml.x3d, moved the existing one from the application's plugin folder, and copied mine in. It also failed on load. So I'm guessing that there is something in my Visual Studio build setup that is not right, but I don't know what.
title: Re:Where are the VE Author logs for plug-in loading?

author: Timothy Lyanguzov
text: Hi Russel,Which version of VE Author do you use? You can get this information from About dialog. Is it 32 or 64-bit? How do you compile plugin? It should be compiled using Release configuration and corresponding platform (Win32 or x64). Which version of Visual Studio are you using?I compiled Release/x64 version of vrml plugin and it works correctly in 7.1.0.185 version of VE Author x64.Best regards,Timothy Lyanguzov
title: Re:Where are the VE Author logs for plug-in loading?

author: Russell Harris
text: Thank you very much. I was building as Win32 and should have been building as x64. I should have thought of that.For information only now:SAP Visual Enterprise Author 7.1 x64, Version 7.1.8.7, 13 December 2013.Visual Studio Express 2012, Version 11.0.61030.00 Update 4Thank you again.
title: Re:Where are the VE Author logs for plug-in loading?
Visual Enterprise viewer SDK for Android - crash and closes application
text: Hello,  we are developing an app for android that uses Visual Enterprise SDK 8.0 but we have problem with some unexpected crash of app when trying to open a VDS file - it is seemed to be some device-specific failure as it works on some Acer devices but fails on new Sony Zperia Z tablet and Google Nexus 4 & 7. From the logcat we see that it is some error in library that ends up with signal 11 which cuses android app to close. Did anyone experienced the same issue? Are there any ways to solve it?PS: we did testing with SDK 7.1 and SDK 8.0 - both no success Best regards, Artem
author: Artem Ruzak

title: 3d visual enterprise generator 8.0
text: Hello all,Im confused about the documentation: Installation Guide SAP 3D Visual Enterprise Generator 8.0.I have to integrate the Visual Generator with the ERP and Content Server and the solution is: by user/pwd ( but for this I need the .zip file from note 1694219, which is not available) and the SSL certificate ( which I have no idea what is it).Pls any advise to fix thisthxChris
author: Chris Nicholson
Fergal Dalton
text: Hi Chris,I contacted the responsible people and the note is now available.Secure Socket Layer (SSL) is described in the guide in section5.2.1 Configuring Authentication: Certificate Exchange:This method is based on the mutual trust of Client Authentication certificates between an SAP System and an SAP 3D Visual Enterprise Generator installation.So you will need to create digitally signed certificates for both your ERP and your Visual Enterprise Generator system to establish trust.If you want to setup your landscape to use SSL then you will need to jump to sectionCertificate Exchange (Just below section 5.2.1)The SAP system and SAP 3D Visual Enterprise Generator communicate with each other using Web services. The SAP system calls Web services to start and stop conversion jobs on the SAP 3D Visual Enterprise Generator system, and the SAP 3D Visual Enterprise Generator calls Web services to log statuses on the SAP system.Both sides require authentication to call Web services. This requires client certificates to be mapped to users on both sides. The systems therefore need to identify and authenticate the other sides certificate.This section explains how the certificates are implemented, exchanged, and mapped to a user.Personally the other method is much easier to implement.I hope this helps in some way.Kind RegardsFergal.
title: Re:3d visual enterprise generator 8.0

author: Chris Nicholson
text: Hello Fergal,I did something, but I have a question: when I start the SAP 3D Visual Data Integration Upload Client 8.0 the wrong URL is there. Any idea where should I use it?thxchris
title: Re:3d visual enterprise generator 8.0

author: Fergal Dalton
text: Hi Chris,I thinks it's in the guide, here is the one i usehttp://machinename:80/SAPERPIntegrationService/ now you have to ensure you are using port 80 and that its not blocked by your firewall etc (for me i had to change this port in IIS to get it to work).I think also you need to configure IIS for anonymous access for it to work.Also make sure you have your VDI workflow configured for it to work.hope this helps.Kind RegardsFergal.
title: Re:3d visual enterprise generator 8.0

author: Chris Nicholson
text: Hello Fergal,are u sure about port 80? cause does not work. And Im out of ideas.ThxChris
title: Re:3d visual enterprise generator 8.0

author: Fergal Dalton
text: Hi Chris,You will need to check which port you have enabled for http in IIS. What I meant above was that when used port 80 it turned out it was blocked, so i could not use it. I then reconfigured IIS and used port 8080 and it worked.Kind RegardsFergal.
title: Re:3d visual enterprise generator 8.0

author: Fergal Dalton
text: Hi Chris,Just wondering did this work, you can also try pointing directly to the services file.http://computername:8080/SAPERPIntegrationService/ERPIntegrationService.svcKind RegardsFergal.
title: Re:3d visual enterprise generator 8.0
SAP VEV Javascript API
text: Hello,I would like to script part of the VEV using Javascript inside the browser.Is there any documentation that shows the available functions?Specifically also controlling the play and next step functions and for registering to clickson certain elements in the model?Kind Regards,Christoph Mertins
author: Christoph Mertins
Adam Duran
text: Hello Christoph,I believe what you are looking for is...SCN - SAP 3D Visual Enterprise Viewer SDK 8.0The SAP 3D Visual Enterprise Viewer SDK is a set of documentation and examples for use with the API in the product SAP 3D Visual Enterprise Viewer. The SDK enables developers to embed the viewer in custom solutions by hosting its active-x component. The viewer can be embedded in SAP GUI, NWBC, and HTML for a rich 3D experience. The 3D Viewer enables free distribution of sophisticated viewing, collaboration, publishing and markup capabilities to everyone in the enterprise.You may also look at a new HTML 5 Viewer that requires no download. However it does require IE11 or Chrome to function properly. More Browsers will be added soon. It is part of the following SDK.SAP 3D Visual Enterprise applications SDK 2.0New in the SAP 3D Visual Enterprise applications SDK is the HTML5 Viewer. This viewer enables a no download client for viewing 3D models. This means no plugin or installation is required by the users to view a 3D model. To view a list of WebGL compatible browsers follow this link http://caniuse.com/webgl. This is also capable of creating iOS, Windows, and Android apps. Link to all VE SAP Store DownloadsRegards,-Adam
title: Re:SAP VEV Javascript API
Pre-Requisites for 3D VE
text: Hi, I am new to 3D Visual enterprise development. I would like to know the system requirements and process overview. Is DMS required for 3D VE or GOS can be used to store and retrieve file info. Request Gurus to put some light on end-to-end integration of 3D VE with SAP GUI as well as Web UI.Thanks,Siva
author: Sivadurga Prasad Madhuranthakam
Patrick Ashby
text: Hi Siva,When integrated with ERP, VEG provides out of the box support for storage to DMS. Currently there is no out of the box integration with other document management services. However VEG provides many customization points where RFC or WEB services can be called which would allow for services or custom development to provide this functionality.Kind Regards,Pat.
title: Re:Pre-Requisites for 3D VE

author: Sivadurga Prasad Madhuranthakam
text: Pat, thanks for your reply. Can you please guide me, where I can find material or information related to 3D VE. I could not able to any in forums.Thanks and regards,Siva
title: Re:Pre-Requisites for 3D VE

author: Patrick Ashby
text: Hi Siva,Sorry for the delay in my reply. This link might be helpful SAP 3D Visual Enterprise Generator 8.0  SAP Help Portal PageSystem requirements are listed in the installation guide.Kind Regards,Pat.
title: Re:Pre-Requisites for 3D VE

author: kaushik hegde
Artem Ruzak

author: Adam Duran

title: Re:Sample visual enterprise VDS File
Question on possible bug with trial version of SAP 3D Visual Viewer
text: On 8/1/2014, I downloaded the trial version of SAP 3D Visual Viewer which was version 8.0.100.27428, Jun 18 2014. As of today, the same version is still available.I encountered a bug when we are an activeX component . The viewer does not always open the graphic but just displays the SAP splash screen in thebrowser window. Has anyone seen this before?. Can anyone help?
author: Ellen Miller-Grant
Paul Delany
text: Hi EllenDue to issues with the Viewer being Free and the architecture if SCN the download of the full Viewer version is contained under the Trial download button. So you have the full released version.Regarding your bug can you supply some more information? It sounds like the problem is intermittent since you say "The viewer does not always..."What browser and version are you using?What type of file are you trying to open?Does the same file open every time using the stand alone desktop version of the Viewer?RegardsPaul
title: Re:Question on possible bug with trial version of SAP 3D Visual Viewer
How to change language of SAP Visual Enterprise Viewer ?
text: Hi Guys,How to change language of SAP Visual Enterprise Viewer ?I don't find the place to change it.Thanks.BR,Jacky
author: Jacky Wu
Paul Delany
text: Hi JackyUnder the 'help' menu there is a language option dropdown box. Select the language and then close and reopen Viewer for the selected language to be applied.RegardsPaul
title: Re:How to change language of SAP Visual Enterprise Viewer ?

author: Jacky Wu
text: Hi Paul,Thanks for your reply.I can find 'language' option in 'help' menu in the version 8.0.But I can not find same option in version 7.1.Do you have any idea for it?Thanks.Regards,Jacky
title: Re:How to change language of SAP Visual Enterprise Viewer ?

author: Paul Delany
text: Hi JackyThe Language option was not introduced until Viewer 8.0. In Viewer 7.1 Viewer detects your computers regional language setting and switches to that language.RegardsPaul
title: Re:How to change language of SAP Visual Enterprise Viewer ?

author: Jacky Wu
text: Thanks.
title: Re:How to change language of SAP Visual Enterprise Viewer ?
3D-PDF-Animation, Views button with Acrobat Pro XI not work
text: Hello Support,we are working with the Adobe Acrobat Pro XI an SAP VEA8.0 and Autocad2015.After the last Update from Acrobat IX to XI the animation , views button in the 3D-PDF dont work.The PDF-Template from 2013(IX) have no problems with the animation and views button. With the 2014(XI) template no function of the button after insert the 3D-Modell with SAP VEA or Deep Exploration.What say Adobe:////////////////////////////You should download the plug-in from here (though you probably had it preinstalled with the authoring application)http://scn.sap.com/community/developer-center/3d-visual-enterpriseand check any readme files; there, they usually write some compatibility info.This is a question you should post in the authoring application Forum unless someone here has direct experience with SAP VEA or Deep Exploration.In general, I'd say that Acrobat 3D functionalities have not changed much from version X to XI but a lot from 9 to X. However, the 3D viewing capabilities should have been unaltered since 8 (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RpVmVIp5a2w) and the (3D) Acrobat JavaScript API too (http://www.adobe.com/content/dam/Adobe/en/devnet/acrobat/pdfs/js_api_reference.pdf and http://www.adobe.com/content/dam/Adobe/en/devnet/acrobat/pdfs/js_3d_api_reference.pdf). On the other hand, your templates may be originated from LiveCycle Designer which relies on a slightly different JavaScript API from Acrobat's. I am not sure but I think that also the LiveCycle Designer which used to be shipped with Acrobat Pro 9 is mostly compatible with the latest standalone version. Finally, the low-level C++ API which is needed to write Acrobat plug-ins such as your RHTemplateDesigner.api is almost certainly not changed since Acrobat 9.////////////////////////////I have 2 example that show live the "error" in the pdf. When someone from the sap-employes is interested can i send the cloud-link to the file.Thank for your helpBest regardsManfredIs here the problem 2011?C:\Program Files (x86)\Adobe\Acrobat 11.0\Acrobat\plug_ins\RHTemplateDesigner.api Version: 4.1.41.1036 Beta Creation Date: 2011/09/14 Creation Time: 10:19:02
author: Borm Manfred
Vladimir Noskov
text: Hi Manfred, Could you please send me link to PDF which doesn't work, I will check.thank you,Vladimir Noskov
title: Re:3D-PDF-Animation, Views button with Acrobat Pro XI not work

author: Borm Manfred
text: Hello again,next answer from Adobe://///////////////Adobe stepped away from integration of 3D back with the release of Acrobat X. With today's Acrobat (XI) you'll be wanting the plug-ins provided by 3rd-party "partners" such as:http://www.tetra4d.com/Be well.../////////////////is that true?
title: Re:3D-PDF-Animation, Views button with Acrobat Pro XI not work

author: Vladimir Noskov
text: Hi Borm,What they meant is Acrobat's functionality to import and embed 3D. But 3D viewer component will remain in further versions of Acrobat and Reader (PDF's compatibility has to be kept). regards,Vladimir Noskov
title: Re:3D-PDF-Animation, Views button with Acrobat Pro XI not work

author: Borm Manfred
text: ...1 Week ago.
title: Re:3D-PDF-Animation, Views button with Acrobat Pro XI not work

author: Vladimir Noskov
text: Hi Borm,Could you please send us that shows error so we can investigate.thank you,Vladimir Noskov
title: Re:3D-PDF-Animation, Views button with Acrobat Pro XI not work

author: Borm Manfred
text: Can i have your directly email adress?
title: Re:3D-PDF-Animation, Views button with Acrobat Pro XI not work

author: Vladimir Noskov
text: Certainly, please "Follow" me and I will be able to send you email by private message
title: Re:3D-PDF-Animation, Views button with Acrobat Pro XI not work

author: Borm Manfred
text: ....in this year we generate over 180 3D-PDF drawings.
title: Re:3D-PDF-Animation, Views button with Acrobat Pro XI not work
Which Add-on is required for SAP Business Objects 4.1 for 3D Dashboards?
text: Hello, Which Add-on is required for SAP Business Objects 4.1 for 3D Dashboards? BW version is 7.3 SPS10 moving up to 7.4 SPS5 in the next few months.
author: Gabriel Schroedter
Robert Abarbanel

author: Robert Abarbanel
text: Tooltips grab their text values from cells in the excel sheet as specified the the tooltips properties tab from the viewer. You can have multiple sets of such tips specified. So - all you need to do is fill those cells with the info you want from a universe query or via a web services calL
title: Re:Which Add-on is required for SAP Business Objects 4.1 for 3D Dashboards?
Current SDK's
text: Do the downloadable SDK's posted here remain applicable to the most current VE Author, VE Viewer an VE mobile viewer service pack 2 releases.
author: William Tucker
Paul Delany
text: The SDKs are on a timeline independent of the release timeline of the products. As a general guide the SDKs for Windows Viewer is released shortly after the product. Author has a rule of interface changes only at major releases, so the Author SDK is updated once a major release occurs. The mobile Apps SDK has it's own timeline independent of the mobile Viewer releases for iOS and Android.To answer your specific question regarding SP02. Viewer will release an update to the SDK shortly. Author will not. The Apps SDK 2.1 has just been released and the current SCN download is the latest available.
title: Re:Current SDK's
SAP_COMPUTER VISION

author: sandeep karnati
Paul Delany
text: Hi SandeepI'm not sure exactly what you are after but SAP AR has done work using the Apps SDK for wearables. There is an SCN article with details http://scn.sap.com/community/mobile/blog/2014/09/10/wearables-at-work-sap-launches-augmented-reality-appsI do not recall anyone else using the SDK for Computer Vision. AR would be the closest.RegardsPaul
title: Re:SAP_COMPUTER VISION
How do we open VDS file from Custom Android Application?
text: Hi All,Good Day.Can anyone help us how to open a *.vds file form my custom android application through intent in Visual Enterprise App. We are doing a demo application with Android native code + SMP. We need to play the VDS file as part of the help. Regards,Narayanan L
author: Narayanan Lakshminarasimhan
Michael Murray
text: Hi Narayanan,Sorry for the slow response.If you review the SDK documentation 'Quick Start guide for Android' there is a line in the section 'Add the SDK Libraries' with the example: res = m_core.LoadScene("file:///" + Environment.getExternalStorageDirectory() + "/VDS/file1.vds", null, m_scene);If you use a URL for LoadScene it should download the VDS over the internet. e.g. res = m_core.LoadScene("http://www.test.com/VDS/file1.vds", null, m_scene); If this does not work, it is possible that your web server is not configured to allow downloads of *.vdsIf you are using IIS as your web server then this is almost definitely the case.Kind RegardsMike Murray
title: Re:How do we open VDS file from Custom Android Application?

author: Lalit Mohan Sharma
text: Hi Mike,Thanks for the reply,appreciated your answer,In Android device, we have already installed SAP's Visual Enterprise app from Google play store which is capable to render the model when we tap on any .VDS file in the android device.So,instead of adding SDK Library we can call the Visual Enterprise app with VDS file path as a parameter to render the 3D model from my Custom Android app.we try with the different options with Intent and we able to make it possible.Here is the solutionString fileName=Environment.getExternalStorageDirectory() .getAbsolutePath() + File.separator + "/3D VE Viewer/Pump Service Operation.vds";  File file = new File(fileName); Intent intent = new Intent(Intent.ACTION_VIEW); intent.setDataAndType(Uri.fromFile(file), "application/vds"); intent.setFlags(Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_NO_HISTORY); context.startActivity(intent);Regards, Lalit
title: Re:How do we open VDS file from Custom Android Application?

title: Re:Java SDK to export rh files.

author: John Valentine
text: Hi AlthafI apologize for using your incorrect name in my previous reply.When you say you want to convert "images", what do you mean? 2D images or 3D file format? Vector or raster?Possibly more importantly, how are you generating the input RH files; where do they come from in the first place? If it is from VE Generator, you can probably configure it to deliver a GIF, PNG, or a PDF or some other more convenient image format for you. VE Generator routinely delivers thumbnails for rh files. As a matter of interest, there is a Java wrapper available to allow use of our viewer in a java environment. RegardsJohn Valentine

title: Issue with HTML5 Version Viewer
text: Hello Folks,I just downloaded the SAP3DVisualEnterpriseApplicationsSDKv2_1. in this SDK, i'm trying to run the HTML5 example file index.html.i get a blank screen when i open this file in a browser. any idea why ?i'm on Chrome 40.0.2214.111 (64-bit) and MAc OS X 10.10.2.any help..highly appreciated.thnx,Pramod
author: Pramod Becharli Shankar
Michael Murray
text: Hi Pramod,I know you have resolved this issue via e-mail, but for other people reading this:"The first thing most people do is to try and open this file in a browser directly off disk. This seldom works, because the index.html references JavaScripts in the resources folder and any good browser wont let a file you downloaded from the internet go off and load files from elsewhere on your hard-drive! The best approach is to map ViewerSamples as a local internet site (which gives it implicit permission to load other files) and open it from a URL e.g. http://localhost:8080/index.html If you do want to load directly off disk then you will need to disable web security for your browser. This varies for different browsers, but for chrome the steps are 1) Close all other instances of Chrome 2) start chrome with --disable-web-security flag e.g. [Path to Chrome]/chrome.exe --disable-web-security. Do not set this as your default chrome shortcut as it is dangerous!" you should only do this if you are happy that you trust the source of the file.Kind RegardsMichael MurrayProduct Owner SAP 3D Visual Enterprise ViewerSAP New Zealandmailto:michael.murray01@sap.comwww.sap.com
title: Re:Issue with HTML5 Version Viewer
Integrate 3D Visual Visual Viewer With Agentry
text: Hi all,I am working on SMP 3.0 SDK SP6 for developing Agentry applications. Is there any way to integrate SAP 3D Visual Viewer with Agentry apps? If so, what are the steps to do ?Best Regards,Serkan DEMIR
author: Serkan Demir
Bill Froelich
text: Yes, the integration has already been done and is available "out of the box" for Work Manager 6.1 / 6.2. You will however have to build your Agentry clients to include the Open UI control for the VE Viewer following the appropriate instructions. The Open UI control for the VE Viewer is available as part of the SAP EAM and Service Mobile App SDK 1.0 on the service marketplace.--Bill

title: Stereo in viewer
text: Hello;We managed to compile the stereo plugin for the viewer provided in the SDK (SAP 3D Visual Enterprise Core SDK 8.0\GraphicsCore\stereo).We then tested under SAP Viewer on a workstation with an NVidia 3D Vision 2, quadro 5000, ASUS 3D screen, Windows 7 64 bits and DirectX11.It works rather fine when using the OpenGL render engine in quad-buffer mode.We can't get it to work under DirectX render engine. When selecting 3D vision options we have a warning message "3D vision is not implemented in this build" (see attached capture).After some search we found that this message comes from drvDX9.x3d. When editing this file simply in wordpad we can see all stereo modes are described except the 3D Vision.Would there be a way to implement 3D Vision in drvDX9.x3d ?Next step is to get it working in Author.Thanks for help and advices.Daniel
author: Daniel DILIGENT
Dmitriy Kivilev
text: Hi Daniel!3D Vision was implemented in drvDX9.x3d for some time, but we had to pull it out due to licensing issues with NVidia SDK and also because we could not properly test it (we only had one stereo monitor).In order to have 3D Vision working, drvdx9.x3d would need to be compiled with NVidia SDK again. Technically there should not be anything problematic with it.However I'm not sure how to achieve it process-wise:drvdx9.x3d is an internal plugin, we're not planning to provide source code for it or make custom builds (standard build without NVision and custom build with NVision).If we're going to have NVidia support in official build, then it may take awhile until our next official release and I'm not sure how we're going to test it (as we don't have any stereo monitors now).Please talk to the product owners on how to accomplish this task.Thank youDmitriy
title: Re:Stereo in viewer

author: Daniel DILIGENT
text: Hi Dimitry;OK i do understand those reasons.NVidia SDK : OK this is commercial talkings between SAP and NVidia so might take some time (and money)Source code : it's logic you wont give the code of the plugin to customers and i'm not asking for it.Customized or standard function : well in my opinion this should be a standard functionOnly one 3D monitor : well buy some it's not that much expensive nowadays. For testing i can help you.Product owner : is it Vladimir ? I can contact him.Daniel
title: Re:Stereo in viewer

author: Dmitriy Kivilev
text: Yes, please contact Vladimir.
title: Re:Stereo in viewer
VEV from SAP GUI (monolithic JT): How to receive highlighted parts from VEV and highlight parts in VEV
text: Hi all,I integrate the 3D VEV (Version 8.0.300.42588, May 5 2015) in SAP-GUI via the Interface IF_GUI_VIEWER_CONSUMER_MODEL. Two Items If I load the file via the IF_GUI_VIEWER_CONSUMER_MODEL~LOAD_VIEWER method I can pass the parameter IV_ID_FIELD. If I Ieave it initial, the system sets '$RH.POSID'. The result if I handle the SAP_VISUALIZATION event is an ID like 'POSID_16BA8CE0' e.g. What is '$RH.POSID'? For each viewer call the value is calculated new. Can I use other ID's?Now I request the metadata. I receive the data in the event handler for event IF_GUI_VIEWER_CONSUMER_MODEL~SAP_METADATA. But without the relation to the ID above.If I like to higlight a part in VEV I use the method IF_GUI_VIEWER_CONSUMER_MODEL~SET_VISUALIZATION. I tried to use the ID from above, but without success.It would be great to get some hints.Best regardsJrgen
author: Jürgen Bauer
Asha Mary Lilliett
text: Hi Jrgen, The POSIDs are session IDs generated by the Viewer to identify the parts in the Viewer scene.The other ID that can be used to identify parts in the Viewable is the IV_ID_FIELD. To this field you can pass any metadata in the Viewable which you would like to use as an identifier , it could be SAP Material Number, Equipment number , Document ID etc.So you need to pass the exact metadata tag in IV_ID_FIELD during load , for instance in case of material identifier , you may pass SAP\MATERIAL\0 which corresponds to the metadata tag in Viewable for material.But like I mentioned SET_VISUALIZATION would work on both Identifiers. Also please check if theactivate_visualization flag is set to true in the load method.Best regardsAsha
title: Re:VEV from SAP GUI (monolithic JT): How to receive highlighted parts from VEV and highlight parts in VEV

author: Jürgen Bauer
text: Hello Asha,thank you for your reply.I passed the Tag SAP\MATERIAL\0 by loding the file. But without success. But my JT doesn't contain this metadata respectively I can't see it. I only have CADMetadata in my JT.And I'd like to higlight the part in the viewer via the Tag CADMetadata\Parameters\NH_MATNR:Here are some combinations I tried, to receive Metadata from the viewer:I pass to IV_ID_FIELD your suggestinon (SAP\MATERIAL\0) when I load the file. Result: At Event SAP_VISUALIZATION I get an entry in IT_VISUALIZATION when I higlight a part in the viewer. But this entry doesn't deliver the ID of this part. So I call the method IF_GUI_VIEWER_CONSUMER_MODEL~REQUEST_METADATA from my event handler. Result: At event SAP_METADATA I get no entries in IT_METADATA.I pass my tag CADMetadata\Parameters\NH_MATNR: during loading the file. The result is the same like in 1I leave IV_ID_FIELD empty ($RH.POSID will be set by the system). Now I get entries in IT_VISUALIZATION at SAP_VISUALIZATION and also entries in IT_METADATA at SAP_METADATA. This is allright for me.But in the other direction to highlight viewer parts from SAP I tried also with different combination, but without success.Are there any prerequisites the JT file has to fullfill?Thanking you in anticipationJrgen
title: Re:VEV from SAP GUI (monolithic JT): How to receive highlighted parts from VEV and highlight parts in VEV

Highlight colors in embedded viewer via SDK
text: Right now in our solution when we select a node in our NodesSelectedEvent we are looking to keep highlighting all the children of a given node. This works just fine on our end, however we dont have the ability to change the highlight color of the children much in the way SelectionHighlightColor does for the selected node. Im not seeing anything in the documentation that indicates this is existing functionality but I wanted to confirm that this indeed does not exist. If it doesnt is it possible we can have access in the future to this type of functionality? Thanks!
author: William Tucker
Paul Delany
text: Hi BillThere is no current API to set the childrens highlight colour. In the context menu, Viewer > Settings there is a configurable highlight colour for selections and children. An option is the ability to colour nodes using the Paint call.Do I understand correctly that the select including the children of the selected node is working well however you only want an API exposed so that the child highlight colour can be set?Primary selection highlighting. This type is our current way to highlight selected objects in the viewport.Child highlighting. We have a separate color to highlight children of selected objects to distinguish them from directly selected objects. (If a child of a selected parent is itself directly selected then Selection highlighting is applied to the child, see p.2 below.)User-defined highlighting. This type is used when users specify colors for highlighting objects in tool like QueryUI, StepView Highlighting, Analytics, etc.2. If several types of highlighting are applicable to an object then the color of highlighting type with higher priority will be used. e.g. a user highlighted an object with orange color by running a query and then selected it in the scene tree or viewport, the object is highlighted with red color because primary selection highlighting overrides user-defined highlighting.RegardsPaul
title: Re:Highlight colors in embedded viewer via SDK

author: William Tucker
text: Hi Paul,One of our methods, in an object selectable free-play file, is to give the end user the option to select either individual parts or a "scene tree single folder" assembly via a toggled menu selection mode button. This has worked well with the 7.0 SDK with selecting all of the 'scene tree folder' assembly which included all if the individual child parts of the selected assembly. Our prerequisite was to instruct the end user to change the child color to red, to match the selected object color in the preferences options directly in the VE Viewer 7.0 before opening the 7.0 SDK based user interface. This preference carried through to the embedded VE viewer in the 7.0 SDK based user interface. With the 8.0 SDK, the child color preferences do not carry over into the embedded VE Viewer 8.0 in the 8.0 SDK based user interface. Is there a method we can use to ensure these color choice preferences carry into the embedded 8.0 VE Viewer in the 8.0 SDK based user interface as in 7.0?Legacy compatibility with ongoing projects is of particular importance to ourselves and to our customers. If this is possible, please let us know. I'm the lead VE Author production on this project, however, I'm not the lead 8.0 SDK and VE Viewer implementing software engineer, who may have some additional questions/postings shortly.If this has already been explained in your previous post, my thanks.Best regards,Bill
title: Re:Highlight colors in embedded viewer via SDK
3D VE viewer invalid handle for stdin error
text: I am creating a windows 8.1 kapsel app with VE viewer and I am getting the following error: print: Assertion failed: invalid handle for stdin (1)print: Assertion failed: invalid handle for stdin (1),(printErr)Any idea how to solve it?
author: Esther Simon Carbajo
Michael Murray
text: We have been able to reproduce the issue you have reported using our WebGL Viewer. We have fixed this issue in the current development branch. This fix will be available in the next official release of the SAP Visual Enterprise Applications SDK or as part of the SAP UI5 Visual Interaction toolkit to be delivered as part of SAP UI5 1.32 in the NetWeaver UI Add-Ons 2.0 SP1 release scheduled for October this year.
title: Re:3D VE viewer invalid handle for stdin error
